Whether to switch to night mode automatically (if device supports), manually or via system setting (Android 10+). Manual switching can be done from the 3-dot options menu on the main screen.

Adjust left and right margin of the text view. You can also adjust maximum width of the text.

Align text in \'justify\' style, meaning left and right margins of the text are in line
Add margin (with visual indication) to top of the window that contains Bible document. Bible is scrolled so that current verse starts below the margin.

If you live in a persecuted country, you might need to be careful about downloading christian material via Internet. Instead, you might want to obtain module zip files more securely and install them via "Load Documents From Zip". Are you sure you want to proceed with downloading? All downloads from module servers are encrypted (HTTPS).
Yes, do not ask any more

This will set today as the current day in this plan and mark all previous days as read. Continue?
Are you sure you want to reset this plan?
The reading plan has been deleted
Are you sure you want to delete %s along with it\'s reading history? Hint: if you need to update the plan then you can just import it again with the same filename and the history will be preserved.

There is a user reading plan in sdcard jsword/readingplan with the same name as an internal plan. It can not be listed here. Please rename the file to something else, leaving it\'s file extension as .properties
NT, Psalms & Proverbs in a Year
Courtesy of HEARTLIGHT Internet Magazine, http://www.heartlight.org, permission granted
Plan based on chronological events in the Bible. The chronological time-line is approximate.
Read through the Bible in 1 year, with chapters in the OT and NT every day.
Read through the Bible in 1 year, starting in Genesis and finishing in Revelation. The OT is first, then the NT.

This plan is based on the M’Cheyne reading system, featuring four different readings for use in both family and personal devotions. Each day has two passages from the Old Testament, one from the New Testament, and one from either the Psalms or the Gospels. In one year, you read the Old Testament once and the New Testament and Psalms twice.
Courtesy of Prof. Horner, permission granted
Read through the Bible in 2 years, reading the NT and Psalms twice. Courtesy of Wholesome Words, http://www.wholesomewords.org/, permission granted
A Bible verse has been shared with you using %s.
Hide bookmarks that are marked with specified label(s)

There are bookmarks and/or notes for this document.
If document structure has changed, updating this document could make the locations of these bookmarks/notes move inside the document or disappear completely.

Speak and play earcon sounds for

Set sleep timer. Timer set: %d minutes
Speak bookmarks shortcut buttons will appear here.
Here you can adjust which labels are assigned automatically to bookmarks that you create.
Each bookmark can be assigned multiple labels.
Use %s to specify which label color is shown.
Tap %s icon to have that label is assigned automatically to new bookmarks.
Tap %s to add label to your favourite list for quick access.
Tap %s to re-order the list based on your selections.
These settings determine the default for all workspace windows.
You can override these by changing the individual window settings.
%s icon indicates that the setting comes from the workspace settings.
%s icon indicates that this setting has been changed for this specific window.
Use %1$s button to reset all these settings back to %2$s.

A Speak bookmark will be automatically added when Speak is paused or stopped. Automatically generated bookmarks are labelled with the special Speak label. If you start at a Speak bookmark the bookmark will be moved to the verse you stop or pause at next time. Only Speak labels will be moved, any other labels will be left alone.

Special playback settings (under \"Playback Settings\" on the Speak screen) are saved to Speak bookmarks when this setting is selected. When you restart speaking from a Speak bookmark, the saved playback settings are loaded from the bookmark.

For example if you are listening to Genesis and Romans and wish to listen to Genesis spoken quickly without chapter change notifications, but to Romans more slowly with audible earcon sounds on chapter changes, then you can have different playback settings for these books, when these settings are saved to the corresponding bookmarks.
Repeat passage mode was disabled automatically because speaking was started outside of defined verse range.
Backup to phone or elsewhere via Share function (email, Google Drive etc.)?
Bookmarks, labels, notes, study pads, reading plans, workspaces etc.
What do you want to restore?

My Notes, Bookmarks, Study Pads, Reading Plans and Workspaces backed up successfully.

Restoring database was unsuccessful. Perhaps you gave invalid database file.
Database for %s can be either restored (i.e. existing database is removed and selected database is loaded) or imported (selected database is imported into existing database). What do you want to do?
File containing exported StudyPads (i.e Labels and Bookmarks) can be imported via Main Menu -> Backup & Restore.
\"%1$s\" and %2$s other Label(s) / StudyPad/(s) and %3$s Bookmarks
PLEASE WRITE YOUR FEEDBACK OR BUG REPORT ABOVE THIS LINE
Tell us briefly what did you do / what happened when issue took place.
Sometimes manually taken screenshots also are beneficial in resolving issues.
Please use this function to report as soon as you have noticed issue taking place.
You can also use this function after opening app, after crash has taken place.
Log file produced by this app. It does not contain information about any other apps.
Screenshot of app when crash took place, or when bug report was created.
Having these files attached helps app developers a lot in fixing the reported bug.
Last time when you used the application, it crashed. To help us with fixing the bug, we would appreciate if you send us a bug report.
Page is too large to be loaded
Next, please select your preferred email application (Gmail for example) to send the report to the developer team.
Progress status notification for document downloads etc.
Which settings do you want to copy?
To which workspaces do you want to copy settings?

In beta version, there are new features that are not yet properly tested, and thus using beta might introduce unexpected behavior, i.e. bugs. It is recommended that ordinary Bible readers use stable version instead.
Beta users are encouraged to report bugs via Google Play or (preferably) via %s.
If you are programmer, please consider contributing bug fixes via %s yourself. :-)
Please see video featuring new features of this release (%s).
New version %1$s of %2$s has been installed successfully!

Go to the next or previous chapter by swiping the screen with your finger. Double-tap Bible text to toggle full screen mode. Split screens (called also windows) have menu button on their top-right corner, which enables you to use several window-specific functions and customize window outlook and behaviour.

Long pressing in opens context menu or action mode in several views. Long press on the Bible view to open the action mode for actions affecting the current verse. Long press on a document item in list view of Choose Document or Download to delete document or view information. Long press a bookmark in bookmarks listing to add labels or delete bookmark. Long press links to choose if you want to open them in current window, new window or special links window.

Bookmarks can be created by selecting some text and choosing "Bookmark" from the popup menu. You can add your custom notes to the new bookmark by tapping the now highlighted text in Bible view. There is also a "My Notes" special document in commentaries that allows you to view your notes in a separate window.

Study pads are designed to make it easy to write sermon notes, prepare sermons or just write down personal Bible study notes that have multiple Bible references. Each study pad is associated with one bookmark label. All Bookmarks that have been created with that respective label appear automatically in the study pad document. In addition to bookmarks, there can be custom text entries in a study pad.
Search text can include special characters like *, ?, AND, OR, NOT (see "Apache Lucene - Query Parser Syntax" for more details)
Search text can include special characters like *, AND, OR, NOT

Workspaces allow having multiple context-dependent working environments. Workspace functions can be accessed via Workspaces item in options menu (top-right corner). Quick way to access workspaces is by swipe-down gesture from toolbar. You may also use swipe-left and swipe-right gestures over toolbar to switch to previous / next workspace.

Swipe down from toolbar to show workspace selector. Long press window button to quickly minimize. Long press speak toolbar button to quickly go to speak settings. Long press verse location title in toolbar to jump to document selector. Long press the Back button to access the History list.

You can enable window pinning from options menu (three dots, right top corner). If window pinning is enabled, you may show many pinned windows on Bible view, but only one non-pinned window. Pinned windows are displayed first, and then unpinned windows. You might want to open Bible documents as pinned windows, and commentaries and maps etc. as non-pinned windows. Then you can easily have Bible documents always opened, and switch quickly between commentaries and other extra material when you study Bible.

Thank you for downloading %s. There are currently no Bibles or documents installed. To continue, please install at least 1 document by downloading from the internet, or by loading from a zip file document backup.
You have to choose the file that you want to load to %s.

To select partial or many verses, you can long-press Bible text
To show notifications (download status, processing, speak status), we need your permission.
Rename the app to \'Calculator\' and show a different icon in the launcher.
PIN code to enter the app when the calculator is shown.
Division by zero is not allowed
Wrong Format. Operand Without any numbers?
Instructions for the settings and information about specific discrete build.
Before entering the app, calculator screen is displayed.
In it, you can do standard calculus, and when you want to enter the app, you just type your PIN code (default is 1234) and then press "=" button.
You can set up a custom PIN code by "Calculator PIN" setting.
You are using standard application version, which means that it is still possible to see the real name and icon of the application in app info.
For improved security in persecuted environment, we highly recommend using discrete version of the app, which always displays calculator, even if the app data is deleted.
You can download the latest version of discrete version from %s.

To add a new custom repository, type or copy & paste custom repository URL here.

You can install documents from external custom repositories by installing custom repositories.
